text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Appointment Resource(informative) A scheduled appointment for a patient and/or practitioner(s) where a service may take place
identifier 0..*IdentifierExternal Ids for this item
priority 0..1integerThe priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority) (Need to change back to CodeableConcept)
status 0..1codeThe overall status of the Appointment
ActStatus (Required)
type 0..1CodeableConceptThe type of appointments that is being booked (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself)
reason 0..1CodeableConceptThe reason that this appointment is being scheduled, this is more clinical than administrative
ApptReason (Incomplete)
description 0..1stringThe brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field
start 1..1instantDate/Time that the appointment is to take place
end 1..1instantDate/Time that the appointment is to conclude
slot 0..*SlotThe slot that this appointment is filling. If provided then the schedule will not be provided as slots are not recursive, and the start/end values MUST be the same as from the slot
location 0..1LocationThe primary location that this appointment is to take place
comment 0..1stringAdditional comments about the appointment
order 0..1OrderAn Order that lead to the creation of this appointment
participant 1..*ElementList of participants involved in the appointment
type 0..*CodeableConceptRole of participant in the appointment
ParticipantType (Incomplete)
actor 0..1AnyA Person of device that is participating in the appointment, usually Practitioner, Patient, RelatedPerson or Device
required 0..1coderequired | optional | information-only
ParticipantRequired (Required)
status 1..1codeaccepted | declined | tentative | in-process | completed | needs-action
ParticipationStatus (Required)
lastModifiedBy 0..1Practitioner | Patient | RelatedPersonWho recorded the appointment
lastModified 0..1dateTimeDate when the appointment was recorded

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the Appointment resource

definition.short: (informative) A scheduled appointment for a patient and/or practitioner(s) where a service may take place
definition.formal: (informative) A scheduled appointment for a patient and/or practitioner(s) where a service may take place.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Language of the resource content
definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.short: Contained, inline Resources
definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: External Ids for this item
definition.formal: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

definition.short: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority) (Need to change back to CodeableConcept)
definition.formal: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority) (Need to change back to CodeableConcept).

definition.short: The overall status of the Appointment
definition.formal: Each of the participants has their own participation status which indicates their involvement in the process, however this status indicates the shared status.

definition.short: The type of appointments that is being booked (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself)
definition.formal: The type of appointments that is being booked (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself).

definition.short: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled, this is more clinical than administrative
definition.formal: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled, this is more clinical than administrative.

binding.name: ApptReason
binding.description: The Reason for the appointment to take place

definition.short: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field
definition.formal: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field.

definition.short: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place
definition.formal: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place.

definition.short: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude
definition.formal: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude.

definition.short: The slot that this appointment is filling. If provided then the schedule will not be provided as slots are not recursive, and the start/end values MUST be the same as from the slot
definition.formal: The slot that this appointment is filling. If provided then the schedule will not be provided as slots are not recursive, and the start/end values MUST be the same as from the slot.

definition.short: The primary location that this appointment is to take place
definition.formal: The primary location that this appointment is to take place.

definition.short: Additional comments about the appointment
definition.formal: Additional comments about the appointment.

definition.short: An Order that lead to the creation of this appointment
definition.formal: An Order that lead to the creation of this appointment.

definition.short: List of participants involved in the appointment
definition.formal: List of participants involved in the appointment.

definition.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Role of participant in the appointment
definition.formal: Role of participant in the appointment.

definition.short: A Person of device that is participating in the appointment, usually Practitioner, Patient, RelatedPerson or Device
definition.formal: A Person of device that is participating in the appointment, usually Practitioner, Patient, RelatedPerson or Device.
definition.comments: Should this be multiple? And move to a child enitity.

mapping.map: ATTENDEE: (Need to provide the common name CN and also the MAILTO properties from the practitioner resource)

definition.short: required | optional | information-only
definition.formal: Is this participant required to be present at the meeting. This covers a use-case where 2 doctors need to meet to discuss the results for a specific patient, and the patient is not required to be present.

binding.name: ParticipantRequired
binding.description: Is the Participant required to attend the appointment

definition.short: accepted | declined | tentative | in-process | completed | needs-action
definition.formal: Participation status of the Patient.

binding.name: ParticipationStatus
binding.description: The Participation status of an appointment

definition.short: Who recorded the appointment
definition.formal: Who recorded the appointment.

mapping.map: IAM-14-Reported By (if patient) / IAM-18-Statused By Person (if practitioner)

definition.short: Date when the appointment was recorded
definition.formal: Date when the appointment was recorded.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: actor
searchParam.documentation: Any one of the individuals participating in the appointment

searchParam.name: partstatus
searchParam.documentation: The Participation status of the subject, or other participant on the appointment

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: The overall status of the appointment
